newsitem.title: RUSSIA: TABLE-Russian net reserves double to 61 trln rbls.
newsitem.headline: TABLE-Russian net reserves double to 61 trln rbls.

text.p: Russia's net international reserves rose to 60.9 trillion roubles ($10.5 billion) on July 1 from 31.3 trillion roubles on June 1, central bank first deputy chairman Sergei Aleksashenko told Reuters on Wednesday.

NOTES - Reserves in 1997 calculated at a rate of 5,560 roubles per dollar, in 1996 at 4,640 roubles per dollar. Rouble currently about 5,800 per dollar. This means net reserves were about $10.95 billion on July 1, after $5.63 billion on June 1 and $4.53 billion on July 1, 1996.

Net international reserves are the reserves of the central bank and government, excluding loans from the International Monetary Fund and other liabilities up to one year. Central bank officials say reserves have been growing this year because of dollar purchases in the currency market.
